member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CocoaDefaultPropertyBinding
member.summary: Provides default property bindings for a number of common Cocoa controls.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.KVOObservableForProperty
member.summary: This class provides notifications for Cocoa Framework objects based on Key-Value Observing. Unfortunately, this class is a bit Trickyâ„¢, because of the caveat mentioned below - there is no way up-front to be able to tell whether a given property on an object is Key-Value Observable, we only have to hope for the best :-/

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.Cocoa.LinkerOverrides
member.summary: This class exists to force the MT linker to include properties called by RxUI via reflection

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.NSRunloopScheduler
member.summary: Provides a scheduler which will use the Cocoa main loop to schedule work on. This is the Cocoa equivalent of DispatcherScheduler.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.RoutedViewHost
member.summary: RoutedViewHost is a helper class that will connect a RoutingState to an arbitrary NSView and attempt to load the View for the latest ViewModel as a child view of the target. Usually the target view will be the NSWindow. This is a bit different than the XAML's RoutedViewHost in the sense that this isn't a Control itself, it only manipulates other Views.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.TargetActionCommandBinder
member.summary: TargetActionCommandBinder is an implementation of command binding that understands Cocoa's Target / Action Framework. Many controls in Cocoa that are effectively command sources (i.e. Buttons, Menus, etc), participate in this framework.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ViewModelViewHost
member.summary: ViewModelViewHost is a helper class that will connect a ViewModel to an arbitrary NSView and attempt to load the View for the current ViewModel as a child view of the target. This is a bit different than the XAML's ViewModelViewHost in the sense that this isn't a Control itself, it only manipulates other Views.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.FlexibleCommandBinder.config
member.summary: Configuration map

member.returns: The binding from event.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.FlexibleCommandBinder.ForTargetAction(System.Windows.Input.ICommand,System.Object,System.IObservable{System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a commands binding from event and a property

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.ComponentModelTypeConverter
member.summary: This binding type converter uses the built-in WPF component model conversions to get a whole bunch of conversions for free. Unfortunately, these are pretty gutted on some other platforms like Silverlight.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.Registrations
member.summary: Ignore me. This class is a secret handshake between RxUI and RxUI.Xaml in order to register certain classes on startup that would be difficult to register otherwise.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.PlatformOperations
member.summary: Returns the current orientation of the device on iOS.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView
member.summary: This is an View that is both an NSView and has ReactiveObject powers (i.e. you can call RaiseAndSetIfChanged)

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.Changing
member.summary: Represents an Observable that fires *before* a property is about to be changed.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.Changed
member.summary: Represents an Observable that fires *after* a property has changed.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.SuppressChangeNotifications
member.summary: When this method is called, an object will not fire change notifications (neither traditional nor Observable notifications) until the return value is disposed.
member.returns: An object that, when disposed, reenables change notifications.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.RaiseAndSetIfChanged``1(``0@,``0,System.String)
member.summary: RaiseAndSetIfChanged fully implements a Setter for a read-write property on a ReactiveObject, using CallerMemberName to raise the notification and the ref to the backing field to set the property.
member.typeparam: The type of the return value.
member.param: A Reference to the backing field for this property.
The name of the property, usually automatically provided through the CallerMemberName attribute.
member.returns: The newly set value, normally discarded.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Use this method in your ReactiveObject classes when creating custom properties where raiseAndSetIfChanged doesn't suffice.
member.param: The instance of ReactiveObject on which the property has changed.
A string representing the name of the property that has been changed. Leave null to let the runtime set to caller member name.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.ReactiveView.RaisePropertyChanging(System.String)

member.param: The instance of ReactiveObject on which the property has changed.

member.summary: Interface used to extract a common API between and .

member.summary: Internal class containing the common code between and .

member.summary: Main disposable which is disposed when this object is disposed.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CommonReactiveSource`3.setupDisp
member.summary: Disposable used by the setup procedure.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CommonReactiveSource`3.adapter
member.summary: The adapter of the UIKit view.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CommonReactiveSource`3.SectionInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of sections that this should display. Setting a new value always causes the table view to be reloaded. If the list implements , then the source will react to changes to the contents of the list as well.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CommonReactiveSource`3.sectionInfo
member.summary: Field backing . Initialized to an empty array in order to avoid null reference exceptions if the source is used before a real section info has been set.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Cocoa.CommonReactiveSource`3.DidPerformUpdates
member.summary: IObservable that pushes a new value after the corresponding IUICollViewAdapter finishes processing changes from the underlying collection. Due to the buffered nature of the processing, the value is an IEnumerable of the changes.
member.value: An IEnumerable containing all the changes processed. Note that in some cases those can be different than the change events published by the underlying collection (for example the return value will contain a single Reset event arg even though the collection did not send a Reset, but the adapter performed a Reload nevertheless)
